intro: Rauvolfia serpentina, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and is known for its medicinal properties. Its roots contain alkaloids, particularly reserpine, which have been used in traditional medicine for their hypotensive effects. Rauvolfia serpentina is also valued for its role in modern pharmacology due to its active chemical compounds.
